comment.author: 16044010@N00
comment._content: It's really nice to see the genuine, relaxed smiles... it's easy to think of everything before 1960 as dour due to all the posed photos and lack of color film.  So this is a nice reminder that people have always been regular folk.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think the date written on the negative is 2/10/13

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Although dates scratched on the Bain negatives may not always indicate the date the photograph was made (some negatives bear multiple dates), it looks as though February 1913 would be an accurate date for the photograph. This photographic print of Elizabeth Freeman en route to the parade is dated Feb. 17, 1913: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3b01190 (I'm wondering if the woman smiling on the right in this photograph is, in fact, Elizabeth Freeman.) We'll add date information to the source description and reload it to Flickr. Some Bain photos--among them, the photo of Elizabeth Freeman en route--were included in an essay on the 1913 suffrage parade that highlights the variety of Library of Congress materials that shed light on the event: memory.loc.gov/ammem/awhhtml/aw01e/aw01e.html

comment.author: 84387357@N00
comment._content: I feel sorry for the poor lady on the right who seems to be wearing a commonly ill-fitting vulcanite denture. Actually you could not be too poor to even be able to get any denture. I am dental technician for 30 years and tend to notice these things. Sorry. The Brooklyn Museum just had a great exhibit on The Woman's Suffrage Movement that I went to see at the top floor.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: FYI – It appears that, since bringing these photographs together as the excellent Women Striving Forward ... set, tags and notes have become disabled for photographs within that set.

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for pointing that out--it was entirely unintentional.  We've re-established the settings so it will be possible to add comments, tags, and notes.

comment.author: 10863351@N06
comment._content:
Funny, but like Whiskeygonebad, I also zeroed right in on the woman's horrid looking teeth on the right.  

No offense intended, but it does stand out, doesn't it?

comment.author: 77363298@N00
comment._content: if that is indeed a set of dentures, it's a wonder the woman can smile at all. The woman in the center, however, is adorable, and looks like a load of fun!
